text: Hi Juba! Sorry for the late reply!
Thank you for all the info, it's such a great idea trying to replicate a 2D animation in 3D. I'll give it a try!

I feel like right now I'm transitioning from not knowing what to do next to a vague idea of the path I'm gonna follow. I've always liked to tell stories, my own stories and the ones I find interesting. So far I've written and directed 4 shorts films. One of my friends told me that maybe the way to go would be focusing on Storyboarding and Directing. Start maybe at an animation studio in Vancouver or London (if possible).
I'm sorry, I feel like I'm not probably what you were looking to mentor about and I completely understand if you are more interested in mentoring a pure thoroughbred animator/VFX artist :sweat_smile:

Hahahaha Jorge, not at all! I'm an animator because I have a need to tell stories, VFX was just an opportunity that arose, but my life goal is to become a director as well. So I 100% understand you! :smiley:
Storyboard and layout would give you a lot of tools for your own stories for sure. If you'd like I know some people in the layout/ storyboarding industry I can reach out to and they might be able to give you some specific tips! I'll still be happy to help in anyway I can =D
